summary: Internal FBI and US Attorney's Office email chain from June 25, 2019, coordinating victim notification procedures in anticipation of Jeffrey Epstein's arrest. The emails stress the importance of compiling and indexing victim information in the Victim Notification System (VNS) and ensuring all identified victims are notified of charges filed.

persons.name: Justin
persons.context: Mentioned as a point of contact at the US Attorney's Office who is aware of the victim notification situation regarding Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Sean Watson
persons.context: Referenced as part of the FBI team, but specifically noted that victim information should be sent to the team minus him.

events.title: Coordination for Epstein Victim Notification
events.description: Internal emails between FBI and US Attorney's Office personnel discussing procedures for victim notification in anticipation of Jeffrey Epstein's arrest, including compiling victim information in VNS.

events.title: FBI Agent Return from Travel
events.description: An FBI agent mentions being in Oklahoma for work and states they won't be back in the office until July 3, 2019.

locations: 1 St. Andrews Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The emails indicate an upcoming arrest of Jeffrey Epstein was anticipated in late June 2019.

The US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) emphasized the extreme importance of having all identified victims in the Victim Notification System (VNS) when the arrest was announced.
Procedures were being established for victims to self-identify via a press release and an 800 number after the arrest.
Specific instructions were given for indexing victim information, including full names, addresses, and complete guardian information for minors.
The communication highlights inter-agency coordination between the FBI and the USAO/SDNY to ensure compliance with federal victim notification laws.
